thread.title: Julia Louis-Dreyfus calls travel ban a ‘blemish’ at SAG Awards
thread.title_full: Julia Louis-Dreyfus calls travel ban a ‘blemish’ at SAG Awards

author: KATE FELDMAN
title: Julia Louis-Dreyfus calls travel ban a ‘blemish’ at SAG Awards
text:
NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Sunday, January 29, 2017, 8:31 PM 
The Screen Actors Guild Awards opened almost immediately with Hollywood’s brightest stars speaking out against President Trump. 
Julia Louis-Dreyfus, who won the first award of the night for best female performance in a comedy series for “Veep,” opened her acceptance speech with a joke about the President’s obsession with the attendance at his inauguration. 
“Whether the Russians did or did not hack the voting at tonight’s SAG awards, I look out on thee million or million and half people in this room and I say this award is legitimate and I won,” she said. “I’m the winner. The winner is me. Landslide.” Julia Louis-Dreyfus called out President Trump’s travel ban during her SAG acceptance speech Sunday night. (Buckner/Variety/REX/Shutterstock/Buckner/Variety/REX/Shutterstock) 
After the laughter died down, Louis-Dreyfus, the daughter of an immigrant who fled religious persecution in Nazi-occupied France, got serious about Trump’s travel ban that put a 90-day ban on travelers with passports from Iran, Iraq, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, Syria and Yemen.
